poem:
Safe Sets

On sets, where lights cast shadows long,  
She speaks of touches – wrong, too strong,  
With whispered words, she bears the scars,  
In the realm of fame beneath bright stars.  
Courage blooms in her quiet fight,  
Exposing truth to claim the night.  
Resilient echoes, shared in light,  
Transform the dark into what's right.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Kate Beckinsale says she has been ‘assaulted’ and ‘felt up’ on film sets Kate Beckinsale, the British star of films such as Love & Friendship, Canary Black and the Underworld series, has posted a video on social media in response to Blake Lively, who is involved in a legal battle with It Ends With Us director Justin Baldoni. Beckinsale says she has been “assaulted” and “felt up” on film sets, and was insulted and called". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
